PARAGRAPH.STRING: is the highest peak in the U.S. state of New Mexico, with an elevation of 13,161 feet (4,011 m).
is located in the northern part of the state, northeast of Taos.
lies in the Sangre de Cristo Mountains, the southernmost subrange of the Rocky Mountains.

Named in honor of Major George Montague Wheeler (1832 - 1909) who for ten years led a party of surveyors and naturalists collecting geologic, biologic, planimetric and topographic data in New Mexico and six other southwestern states.
was formerly called Taos Peak, after the nearby town of Taos, New Mexico.
